channel.title: new code to run AppArmor/Firejail together?
channel.description:
I know there was a discussion a while back about running AppArmor and Firejail together. I believe it was decided that there may be some coding conflicts for the two. I don't know when this was added but on the Firejail ArchWiki section 3.3 on the page it describes running both:
https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/firejail#Enable_AppArmor_support
I know Arch is not Debian but is that coding apply-able or desirable for Whonix?

item.title: new code to run AppArmor/Firejail together?
item.dc:creator: ThatNewDude
item.description:
Thank you for clarifying that issue.

Read full topic
item.source: new code to run AppArmor/Firejail together?

item.title: new code to run AppArmor/Firejail together?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Free_Support_Principle applies.

If you perform a websearch “firejail apparmor” the first result is this:
https://firejail.wordpress.com/documentation-2/basic-usage/#apparmor

For this it’s best to primarily rely on either upstream for information / questions.

ThatNewDude:

I believe it was decided that there may be some coding conflicts for the two.

No.

Reason:
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Dev/Firejail#Status_of_Firejail_in_Whonix

Read full topic
item.source: new code to run AppArmor/Firejail together?
